name: San Francisco
description: San Francisco is a city on the west coast of the United States. It is the second most populous city in California, and the 13th most populous city in the United States. San Francisco is known for its steep hills, cable cars, fog, and iconic landmarks such as the Golden Gate Bridge

name: New York City
description: New York City is the most populous city in the United States, and the most populous city in the world by urban area. New York City is known for its skyscrapers, Broadway theaters, and world-famous landmarks such as the Empire State Building, Times Square, and the Statue of Liberty.

name: London
description: London is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. It is the most populous city in the United Kingdom, and the most populous city in Europe by urban area. London is known for its history, culture, and iconic landmarks such as Buckingham Palace, the Tower of London, and Big Ben.

name: Paris
description: Paris is the capital of France. It is the most populous city in France, and the most populous city in Western Europe. Paris is known for its art, fashion, and architecture. Some of the most famous landmarks in Paris include the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre Museum, and the Notre Dame Cathedral.

name: Tokyo
description: Tokyo is the capital of Japan. It is the most populous city in Japan, and the most populous city in the world by metropolitan area. Tokyo is known for its technology, anime, and pop culture. Some of the most famous landmarks in Tokyo include the Tokyo Tower, the Sens≈ç-ji Temple, and the Imperial Palace.
